text: MATH312: Assignment 1 25 pts Sep 15, 2023 Due Date: Sep 25, 2023 1. A set which is a subset of the real numbers is well-ordered if the set has a least element. State which of the following sets are well-ordered, with full details justifying your answer. (8pts; 2x4) (a) The set of even positive integers. (b) The set of positive rational numbers of the form a/2 wherea is a positive integer. (c) The set of non-negative real rational numbers. (d) The set of all positive integers of the form a − bk. 2. The greatest integer of a real number x denoted by [x] is the largest integer less than or equal to x, so x satisﬁes [x] ≤ x < [x] + 1. The greatest integer of x is also called the integral part of x. The fractional part of a real number x denoted {x} is the diﬀerence between x and the largest integer less than or equal to x, i.e. {x} = x − [x]. Write down the values of [−1/4], {8/5}, {7}, [22/7], {−22/7}, [5/4], [−11/4], {−1/3}. 4pts 3.
